titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Lyn Nofziger Papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Supriya Wronkiewicz and Max Siekierski

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-04-21T12:09-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: April 11, 2014: Added description for reformatted film Corrected Audiovisual File to reflect correct media format/type and updated location

physdesc.extent: 20 manuscript boxes, 1 oversize box, 1 videotape, 1 motion picture reel

did.abstract: The papers primarily consist of Nofziger's writings as reporter, political consultant, writer and satirical poet; collected materials relating to political conditions in California and the United States, and documents generated from work with Republican candidates including Richard M. Nixon and Ronald Reagan. Also included are materials regarding United States vs. Nofziger pertaining to his alleged violation of the Ethics in Government Act.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Lyn Nofziger Papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2010.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Bakersfield, CA
Married Bonnie Jean Foster
BA, San Jose State College
Copley Newspapers and News Service, reporter, editor, and Washington correspondent
Press secretary, Ronald Reagan's California gubernatorial campaign
Director of communications for California Governor Ronald Reagan
Political consultant
Deputy assistant for Congressional Relations for President Richard Nixon
Deputy chair of communications, Republican National Committee
Executive director, California Committee to Re-elect President Nixon
Political consultant
Press secretary, California campaign director, convention director, Ronald Reagan's presidential primary campaign
Special projects, Gerald Ford's presidential campaign
Executive vice chair, Citizens for the Republic Political Action Committee
Deputy chair of finance, Ronald Reagan presidential campaign
Political consultant
Press secretary, Ronald Reagan presidential campaign
Assistant to the President for political affairs for President Ronald Reagan
Nofziger & Bragg Communications, political and government consulting
Senior adviser, Reagan presidential re-election campaign
Indicted for violation of the Ethics in Government Act

Author, Nofziger (memoir), published by Regnery Gateway
Author, Unbridled Joy: The Verse of Joy Skilmer, published by MND Books
Author, The Tacketts published by Jameson Books
Died, Falls Church, Virginia
Contemporary Authors Online, Gale, 2010. Reproduced in Biography Resource Center. Farmington Hills, Mich.: Gale, 2010. http://galenet.galegroup.com/servlet/BioRC

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The papers primarily consist of Nofziger's writings as reporter, political consultant, writer and satirical poet; collected materials relating to political conditions in California and the United States; and documents generated from work with Republican candidates including Richard M. Nixon and Ronald Reagan. Also included are materials regarding United States v. Nofziger pertaining to his alleged violation of the Ethics in Government Act.

One of the most significant aspects of Nofziger's career was his work as a political consultant for candidates at federal and state levels. While he worked for several Republican candidates, two of the most prominent were Richard Nixon and Ronald Reagan. In the Richard Nixon administration records are correspondence and associated documents involving Nixon and key members of his staff such as H. R. Haldeman and Charles Colson, as well as the California Committee for the Re-election of the President, which played a significant role in Nixon's re-election campaign in 1972.

Nofziger shared a strong affiliation with Ronald Reagan. The Ronald Reagan related materials reflect that affiliation through letters, memoranda and collected printed items. The bulk of the materials are Reagan's speeches and writings, Nofziger's writings specifically related to Ronald Reagan, writings by others regarding Reagan and newspaper clippings and other print media from Reagan's gubernatorial and presidential terms. Photographs also include a collection of autographed images presented to Nofziger by high ranking officials in the first Reagan presidential administration.

Nofziger was also a political consultant for candidates such as Ed Reinecke, Bob Dole, and Pat Buchanan. The Political consulting records documents this work. Campaign paraphernalia from candidates Nofziger supported is present in Memorabilia.

Speeches and writings offer an insight into the evolution of thought and philosophy for the American conservative movement and the Republican Party from Nofziger's candid and uncensored point of view. The writings consist of newspaper articles, speeches, personal reflections, and commentaries in drafts and printed copies.

Nofziger was prosecuted on charges of violating the Ethics in Government Act for illegally lobbying for the Wedtech Corporation for federal defense contracts shortly after resigning from Reagan's first presidential administration. Many of the documents relevant to the indictment, trial, appeal, and subsequent dismissal of the charges are included in the Legal proceedings and related documents.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes biographies, personal correspondence, family records, and hand-drawn sketches of Nofziger. Arranged by document type.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a family tree and other documents regarding Nofziger's family since 1919

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a sketch by Mike Peters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of drafts and printed transcripts of speeches, broadcasts, interviews and panels; drafts and printed copies of articles, and personal writings. Press releases, reviews and correspondence about his printed works, primarily focusing on his autobiography, Nofziger, are also present. Arranged in three groups: speeches, writings, and interview transcripts.

did.unittitle: Interview by Sarah Sharp while Nofziger served as Reagan's press secretary,

Interview, Miller Center of Public Affairs,

scopecontent.p: Interview done as part of President Ronald Reagan Oral History Project

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence with various associates and colleagues as well as correspondence in which Nofziger was copied. The majority of the correspondence is from groups and individuals with last name going from A to C. Arranged alphabetically by correspondent. See also the Richard Nixon administrative records and the Ronald Reagan materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence and associated documents with Nixon and members of his staff as well as records of the Republication National Committee from 1970 to 1971. Also includes records from the California Committee for the Re-election of the President. Arranged as follows: Correspondence and Memoranda, Speech, and Subject File.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily comprised of letters, memoranda, and collected printed items from Nofziger's association with Reagan. Also contains speeches and writings by Ronald Reagan from his term as governor. Arranged as follows: Correspondence, Newspaper clippings and other print media, Speeches and writings, Subject file, and Miscellany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes documents pertaining to various legal incidents in Nofziger's history. The bulk of the documentation regards United States vs. Nofziger, a violation of the Ethics in Government Act because of his lobbying for Wedtech Corporation. Materials arranged as follows: Clippings and press, Correspondence, Invoices and related correspondence, United States vs. Nofziger records, Nofziger's writings, Civil suits records and related materials, Wedtech Securities Litigation related civil suits, and Legal Defense Fund (LDF) records.
